conbody.p: The Bootstrap MariaDB section is used for configuring parameters for Bootstrap MariaDB component. The following table describes the parameters of the Bootstrap MariaDB section.

row.entry: If Resource Naming Convention 4 is used during installation on VMWare, then take care of complete hostname of ioho nodes.

entry.p: This parameter is a collection of records of MariaDB users that must be added to the database at installation time. This parameter contains two predefined users.

row.entry: This parameter defines the DB object to which a user is given access.
This parameter defines whether or not a user is granted any privileges.
This parameter defines the host. If this parameter is left blank, than the user is given access from any host.
This parameter defines the database user for alarms.
This parameter defines the database user for Web SSO service.

entry.p: This parameter is a collection of records of built-in users for MariaDB. Each record contains a password and a username.

row.entry: This parameter defines MariaDB root user. The password for this user applies to all root users for all hosts during database installation. The root user password must be the same for all the hosts in a cluster or a replication set.
Do not modify the username and the password.
This parameter defines the default replication user, which is assigned in the database during installation in a replication configuration.Â
Do not modify the username and the password.
This parameter defines the user for MaxScale monitoring and management task for a database cluster.
Do not modify the username and the password.
